column1: File:Jeff Reitz - Anor-stone.jpg - Palantír of Minas Anor
The Anor-stone was the Gondor palantíri kept at Minas Tirith
column2: taking its name from the older title of that city
column3: Minas Anor. It was kept an unused secret by the Ruling Stewards until it was ultimately used by Steward Denethor to watch his land
column4: and he eventually even challenged Sauron in a battle of wills.  Denethor did not become corrupted
column5: but the great effort of will that this required of him led him to age quickly.  He was holding the stone when he committed suicide on a funeral pyre
column7: only people of exceeding power could see in it anything other than two flaming hands.
